Package de.presti.ree6.sql

Class SQLConnector

java.lang.Object
de.presti.ree6.sql.SQLConnector
public class SQLConnector extends Object
A "Connector" Class which connect with the used Database Server. Used to manage the connection between Server and Client.

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private boolean
    connectedOnce
    A boolean to keep track if there was at least one valid connection.

  • Constructor Details

    • SQLConnector

      public SQLConnector(String databaseUser, String databaseName, String databasePassword, String databaseServerIP, int databaseServerPort)
      Constructor with the needed data to open an SQL connection.
      Parameters:
      databaseUser - the Database Username
      databaseName - the Database name
      databasePassword - the Database User password
      databaseServerIP - the Address of the Database Server.
      databaseServerPort - the Port of the Database Server.

  • Method Details

      Try to open a connection to the SQL Server with the given data.

      Create Tables in the Database if they aren't already set.

      Build the Connection URL with the given data.
      Returns:
      the Connection URL.

    • querySQL

      public Object querySQL(String sqlQuery, Object... parameters)
      Query basic SQL Statements, without using the ORM-System.
      Parameters:
      sqlQuery - The SQL Query.
      parameters - The Parameters for the Query.
      Returns:
      Either a Integer or the result object of the ResultSet.

    • querySQL

      public <R> org.hibernate.query.Query<R> querySQL(@NotNull R r, @NotNull @NotNull String sqlQuery, @Nullable @Nullable Map<String,Object> parameters)
      Send an SQL-Query to SQL-Server and get the response.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The Class entity.
      Parameters:
      r - The class entity.
      sqlQuery - the SQL-Query.
      parameters - a list with all parameters that should be considered.
      Returns:
      The Result from the SQL-Server.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Check if there is an open connection to the Database Server.
      Returns:
      boolean If the connection is opened.

    • close

      public void close()
      Call to close the current Connection.

      Returns:

    • connectedOnce

      Check if there was at least one successful Connection to the Database Server.
